intro: Schizolegnia coursii, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
